title: Pandemic Jobless Benefits and Work
sub_head: A new study shows the enhanced payments reduced employment.
body:
Covid-19â€™s Omicron variant is causing new business disruption, but the good news is that continuing jobless claims have fallen to the lowest since March 7. Companies are having a hard time finding workers, and a new National Bureau of Economic Research working paper shows the job market would have bounced back even faster without expanded unemployment benefits.
Congress at the outset of the pandemic increased the generosity of unemployment benefits while extending eligibility to many Americans who previously would not have qualified, including independent contractors and part-time workers. The maximum duration of benefits was extended to as many as 99 weeks from the typical 26.
